qas.question: What is a major means of the spread of diarrhea disease?
What has cut the rate of diarrhea disease incidents?

answers.text: clean water supply and improved sanitation

qas.question: What would be the reduction in deisease incedence if there was better water and sanitation?
What is major way disease instance is spread?
By what percentage will diarrheal disease be reduced as a result of improved water and hygene?

plausible_answers.text: clean water supply and improved sanitation

qas.question: What has cut the rate of mortality?
What is the reduction in mortality rate associated with disease instance?
What is a cause of child mortality?

context: Given that <a0_0><b3_0><b7_0>water contamination<b7_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> is a major means of transmitting diarrheal disease, efforts to provide <a1_0><b5_0>clean water supply and improved sanitation<b5_0/><a1_0/> have the potential to dramatically cut the rate of disease incidence. In fact, it has been proposed that we might expect an <b4_0>88%<b4_0/> reduction in child mortality resulting from diarrheal disease as a result of improved water sanitation and hygiene. Similarly, a meta-analysis of numerous studies on improving water supply and sanitation shows a <a2_0>22–27% reduction in disease incidence<a2_0/>, and a <b6_0>21–30%<b6_0/> reduction in mortality rate associated with diarrheal disease.
